com.bigdata.rdf.task

Class AbstractApiTask<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.rdf.task.AbstractApiTask<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IReadOnly, IApiTask<T>, Callable<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractRestApiTask, CreateKBTask, DestroyKBTask

    public abstract class AbstractApiTask<T>
extends Object
implements IApiTask<T>, IReadOnly
    Base class for task-oriented concurrency. Directly derived classes are suitable for internal tasks (stored queries, stored procedures, etc) while REST API tasks are based on a specialized subclass that also provides for access to the HTTP request and response. CAUTION: Instances of this class that perform mutations MUST throw an exception if they do not want to join a commit group. Failure to follow this guideline can break the ACID contract.
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson
    See Also:
    Concurrent unisolated operations against multiple KBs

      • AbstractApiTask

        protected AbstractApiTask(String namespace,
               long timestamp,
               boolean isGRSRequired)
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace of the target KB instance.
        timestamp - The timestamp of the view of that KB instance.
        isGRSRequired - True iff a lock must be obtain on the Global Row Store (GRS). For example, the GRS is required for create/destroy of a relation (triple/quad store, etc).

    • Method Detail

      • isReadOnly

        public abstract boolean isReadOnly()
        Description copied from interface: IReadOnly
        Return true iff the procedure asserts that it will not write on the index. When true, the procedure may be run against a view of the index that is read-only or which allows concurrent processes to read on the same index object. When false the procedure will be run against a mutable view of the index (assuming that the procedure is executed in a context that has access to a mutable index view).
        Specified by:
        isReadOnly in interface IReadOnly

      • isGRSRequired

        public boolean isGRSRequired()
        Description copied from interface: IApiTask
        Tasks that create or destroy locatable resources need to write on the global row store (GRS). Such tasks must specify this property. Note that the GRS lock will have the side-effect of serializing all such tasks that write on the GRS index.
        Specified by:
        isGRSRequired in interface IApiTask<T>

      • getTripleStore

        protected AbstractTripleStore getTripleStore()

      • getTripleStore

        protected AbstractTripleStore getTripleStore(String namespace,
                                 long timestamp)
        Return a view of the AbstractTripleStore for the given namespace that will read on the commit point associated with the given timestamp.
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace.
        timestamp - The timestamp or ITx.UNISOLATED to obtain a read/write view of the index.
        Returns:
        The AbstractTripleStore -or- null if none is found for that namespace and timestamp.

      • getQueryConnection

        protected BigdataSailRepositoryConnection getQueryConnection()
                                                      throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Return a connection transaction, which may be either read-only or support mutation depending on the timestamp associated with the task's view. When the timestamp is associated with a historical commit point, this will be a read-only connection. When it is associated with the ITx.UNISOLATED view or a read-write transaction, this will be a mutable connection.

        This version uses the namespace and timestamp associated with the HTTP request.

        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        DatasetNotFoundException

      • getQueryConnection

        protected BigdataSailRepositoryConnection getQueryConnection(String namespace,
                                                 long timestamp)
                                                      throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        This version uses the namespace and timestamp provided by the caller.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getConnection

        protected BigdataSailRepositoryConnection getConnection()
                                                 throws org.openrdf.sail.SailException,
                                                        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Return a connection for the namespace. If the task is associated with either a read/write transaction or an ITx.UNISOLATED view of the indices, the connection may be used to read or write on the namespace. Otherwise the connection will be read-only.
        Returns:
        The connection.
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.sail.SailException
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        DatasetNotFoundException - if the specified namespace does not exist.

      • submitApiTask

        public static <T> FutureTask<T> submitApiTask(IIndexManager indexManager,
                              IApiTask<T> task)
        Submit a task and return a Future for that task. The task will be run on the appropriate executor service depending on the nature of the backing database and the view required by the task.

        This method returns a Future. Remember to do Future.get() on the returned Future to await the group commit.

        Parameters:
        indexManager - The IndexManager.
        task - The task.
        Returns:
        The Future for that task.
        See Also:
        HA doLocalAbort() should interrupt NSS requests and AbstractTasks , Concurrent unisolated operations against multiple KBs
